instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted battery?
threads.message:
Hey there. 2017 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with dead display and battery. USB charger first showed pulsing 5V - 16V in loop. After disconnecting the battery macbook booted, display is obviously dead (flexgate) but external worked.

When reconnecting the battery, USB charger begins to loop again. Found a burnt USB-C port and CB501 was off from one pad. Resoldered but no change for loop.
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> is 12,66V

Is this just a dead battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted battery?
threads.message:
Check <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40 for short between all D-S pins.
Also check resistance (ohm scale) over <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted battery?
threads.message:
Sorry, what's D-S pins? I guess you mean the pins of <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40 - no shorts

<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23 0.00Ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted battery?
threads.message:
All the pins are marked on the schematic; D1, S1, etc.
Need to check between any D-S pair.
Check the same for <TRANSISTOR>Q7065</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted battery?
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q7065</TRANSISTOR> no short. Pin 5 is one pin on the schematics but 4 real pins on the chip, is that correct?
All pins O.L.
Pin 1-3 .373 diode
Pin 1 & 5 .427 diode

P.S. Can i use <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display Panel for this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>?

[ATTACH]60427[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted battery?
threads.message:
All USB-C ports have the same behavior?

You should test with known good battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted battery?
threads.message: No, one port from JB500 doesnt work at all. Macbook is booting from all other ports.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted battery?
threads.message: You should solve that problem first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted battery?
threads.message: I thought i did with all 3 ports booting the machine. How to proceed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted battery?
threads.message:
Post some readings (voltage and diode mode) from non working port.
Compare values with other good port.
